title: 109_hr4265
content: The Act titled "Elizabeth Cady Stanton Pregnant and Parenting Student Services Act of 2005" aims to support pregnant college students by establishing pregnancy and parenting student services offices at eligible institutions of higher education. Congress believes that pregnant students should not have to choose between keeping their baby and continuing their education. The Act also proposes reducing funding from other federal programs to cover its costs. SEC. 3. DEFINITIONS. This Act defines terms such as "eligible institution of higher education," "parent," "parenting," and "Secretary." SEC. 4. PREGNANT AND PARENTING STUDENT SERVICES PILOT PROGRAM. This section establishes a pilot program for pregnant and parenting student services at eligible institutions of higher education. SEC. 4. A pilot program will be established to award grants to eligible institutions of higher education for pregnant and parenting student services offices. An eligible institution of higher education must submit an application to the Secretary to receive a grant under this Act. The Secretary may request additional information if needed. The Secretary will award grants to a maximum of 200 eligible institutions, subject to funding availability. Additionally, there is a matching requirement for the grants. An eligible institution receiving a grant must match the amount with non-Federal funds for the pregnant and parenting student services office. The non-Federal share can be in cash or in kind. An eligible institution of higher education receiving a grant under this Act must establish and operate a pregnant and parenting student services office on campus. The office will host a forum to assess and improve resources for pregnant, parenting, and prospective parenting students. The eligible institution must annually assess the performance of the office in meeting the needs of pregnant or parenting students, including maternity coverage, family housing, child care, flexible academic scheduling, parenting education, and resources for children. The office at the eligible institution assists pregnant and parenting students in meeting their material needs, provides post-partum counseling and support groups, identifies service providers, helps locate services, and offers referrals for prenatal care, delivery, infant care, and adoption. The eligible institution provides support for pregnant and parenting individuals, including parents, prospective parents, pregnant women, and parenting couples. Expanded services may also be offered to pregnant or parenting employees and their spouses. The eligible institution provides support for pregnant and parenting individuals, including parents, prospective parents, pregnant women, and parenting couples. Expanded services may also be offered to pregnant or parenting employees and their spouses. SEC. 8. REPORTING. The eligible institution of higher education must submit an annual report to the Secretary detailing expenditures, evaluating the performance of the pregnant and parenting student services office, and describing how the office meets the needs of students. The Secretary requires annual reports from eligible institutions of higher education detailing expenditures, evaluating the performance of the student services office, and meeting the needs of students. Specific performance criteria and additional information may be requested by the Secretary for evaluation purposes. The Secretary shall annually report on the pilot program findings, including grants awarded to institutions of higher education and the number of students served by each pregnant and parenting student services office receiving funds under this Act. Authorization of appropriations up to $10,000,000 for each fiscal year from 2006 to 2010 is granted to carry out this Act.
